Please go to the following website for detailed information:
 <a href="
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Painted_Skin_%281993_film%29" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Painted_Skin_%281993_film%29</a>

King Hu, the legendary director of kung fu cinema classics Come Drink With Me, Dragon Inn, and A Touch of Zen, completed his last film Painted Skin in 1992 with the aid of action star Sammo Hung. King Hu's Painted Skin tells a story that blends horror, romance, and martial arts in perhaps the best-known version of all screen adaptations.
 Scholar Wong (Adam Cheng) meets a girl named Yau Fung (Joey Wong) on the street one night, and instantly falls under the spell of her ethereal beauty. He brings her home, not realizing that she is actually a ghost. Unable to escape the Yin Yang Demon King's evil clutches, Yau Fung reluctantly obeys his order to be the bait that lures horny men to their death.
 Wong soon gets possessed by the Demon King and is driven on a killing rampage. Fortunately, a Taoist high priest (Sammo Hung) may be able to stop him.
